easy.question: Which of the following is part of the Basis and Purpose of the Amateur Radio Service?
easy.correct_answer: Advancing skills in the technical and communication phases of the radio art

easy.question: What is the FCC Part 97 definition of a beacon?

easy.question: What is the FCC Part 97 definition of a space station?

easy.question: Which of the following entities recommends transmit/receive channels and other parameters for auxiliary and repeater stations?

easy.correct_answer: An observed change in signal frequency caused by relative motion between the satellite and Earth station

easy.question: What is meant by the statement that a satellite is operating in U/V mode?
easy.correct_answer: The satellite uplink is in the 70 centimeter band and the downlink is in the 2 meter band

easy.question: What causes spin fading of satellite signals?
easy.correct_answer: Rotation of the satellite and its antennas

easy.question: What is a LEO satellite?
easy.correct_answer: A satellite in low earth orbit

easy.question: Who may receive telemetry from a space station?
Which of the following is a way to determine whether your satellite uplink power is neither too low nor too high?
easy.correct_answer: Your signal strength on the downlink should be about the same as the beacon

easy.question: Which of the following methods is used to locate sources of noise interference or jamming?
Which of these items would be useful for a hidden transmitter hunt?
What operating activity involves contacting as many stations as possible during a specified period?
Which of the following is good procedure when contacting another station in a contest?
easy.correct_answer: Send only the minimum information needed for proper identification and the contest exchange

easy.question: What is a grid locator?
easy.correct_answer: A letter-number designator assigned to a geographic location

easy.question: How is over the air access to IRLP nodes accomplished?
What is Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP)?
easy.correct_answer: A method of delivering voice communications over the internet using digital techniques

easy.question: What is the Internet Radio Linking Project (IRLP)?
easy.correct_answer: A technique to connect amateur radio systems, such as repeaters, via the internet using Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP)

easy.question: Which of the following protocols enables an amateur station to transmit through a repeater without using a radio to initiate the transmission?
What is required before using the EchoLink system?
easy.correct_answer: Register your call sign and provide proof of license

easy.question: What is an amateur radio station that connects other amateur stations to the internet?
Which of the following is a digital communications mode?
What is a “talkgroup” on a DMR repeater?
easy.correct_answer: A way for groups of users to share a channel at different times without hearing other users on the channel

easy.question: What kind of data can be transmitted by APRS?
What type of transmission is indicated by the term "NTSC?"
easy.correct_answer: An analog fast-scan color TV signal

easy.question: Which of the following is an application of APRS?
easy.correct_answer: Providing real-time tactical digital communications in conjunction with a map showing the locations of stations

easy.question: What does the abbreviation "PSK" mean?
Which of the following describes DMR?
easy.correct_answer: A technique for time-multiplexing two digital voice signals on a single 12.5 kHz repeater channel

easy.question: Which of the following is included in packet radio transmissions?
What is CW?
easy.correct_answer: Another name for a Morse code transmission

easy.question: Which of the following operating activities is supported by digital mode software in the WSJT-X software suite?
What is an ARQ transmission system?
easy.correct_answer: An error correction method in which the receiving station detects errors and sends a request for retransmission

easy.question: Which of the following best describes an amateur radio mesh network?
easy.correct_answer: An amateur-radio based data network using commercial Wi-Fi equipment with modified firmware

easy.question: What is FT8?
easy.correct_answer: A digital mode capable of low signal-to-noise operation

easy.question: What is a beam antenna?
easy.correct_answer: An antenna that concentrates signals in one direction

easy.question: Which of the following describes a type of antenna loading?
easy.correct_answer: Electrically lengthening by inserting inductors in radiating elements

easy.question: Which of the following describes a simple dipole oriented parallel to Earth's surface?
What is a disadvantage of the short, flexible antenna supplied with most handheld radio transceivers, compared to a full-sized quarter-wave antenna?
Which of the following increases the resonant frequency of a dipole antenna?
Which of the following types of antenna offers the greatest gain?
What is a disadvantage of using a handheld VHF transceiver with a flexible antenna inside a vehicle?
easy.correct_answer: Signal strength is reduced due to the shielding effect of the vehicle

easy.question: What is the approximate length, in inches, of a quarter-wavelength vertical antenna for 146 MHz?
What is the approximate length, in inches, of a half-wavelength 6 meter dipole antenna?
In which direction does a half-wave dipole antenna radiate the strongest signal?
What is antenna gain?
easy.correct_answer: The increase in signal strength in a specified direction compared to a reference antenna

easy.question: What is an advantage of a 5/8 wavelength whip antenna for VHF or UHF mobile service?
easy.correct_answer: It has more gain than a 1/4-wavelength antenna

easy.question: What is a benefit of low SWR?
What is the most common impedance of coaxial cables used in amateur radio?
Why is coaxial cable the most common feed line for amateur radio antenna systems?
easy.correct_answer: It is easy to use and requires few special installation considerations

easy.question: What is the major function of an antenna tuner (antenna coupler)?
easy.correct_answer: It matches the antenna system impedance to the transceiver's output impedance

easy.question: What happens as the frequency of a signal in coaxial cable is increased?
Which of the following RF connector types is most suitable for frequencies above 400 MHz?
Which of the following is true of PL-259 type coax connectors?
easy.correct_answer: They are commonly used at HF and VHF frequencies

easy.question: Which of the following is a source of loss in coaxial feed line?
What can cause erratic changes in SWR?
easy.correct_answer: Loose connection in the antenna or feed line

easy.question: What is the electrical difference between RG-58 and RG-213 coaxial cable?
easy.correct_answer: RG-213 cable has less loss at a given frequency

easy.question: Which of the following types of feed line has the lowest loss at VHF and UHF?
What is standing wave ratio (SWR)?
easy.correct_answer: A measure of how well a load is matched to a transmission line

easy.question: Which of the following is a safety hazard of a 12-volt storage battery?
easy.correct_answer: Shorting the terminals can cause burns, fire, or an explosion

easy.question: What health hazard is presented by electrical current flowing through the body?
In the United States, what circuit does black wire insulation indicate in a three-wire 120 V cable?
What is the purpose of a fuse in an electrical circuit?
easy.correct_answer: To remove power in case of overload

easy.question: Why should a 5-ampere fuse never be replaced with a 20-ampere fuse?
easy.correct_answer: Excessive current could cause a fire

easy.question: What is a good way to guard against electrical shock at your station?
Where should a lightning arrester be installed in a coaxial feed line?
easy.correct_answer: On a grounded panel near where feed lines enter the building

easy.question: Where should a fuse or circuit breaker be installed in a 120V AC power circuit?
easy.correct_answer: In series with the hot conductor only

easy.question: What should be done to all external ground rods or earth connections?
easy.correct_answer: Bond them together with heavy wire or conductive strap

easy.question: What hazard is caused by charging or discharging a battery too quickly?
What hazard exists in a power supply immediately after turning it off?
Which of the following precautions should be taken when measuring high voltages with a voltmeter?
easy.correct_answer: Ensure that the voltmeter and leads are rated for use at the voltages to be measured

easy.question: Which of the following is good practice when installing ground wires on a tower for lightning protection?
easy.correct_answer: Ensure that connections are short and direct

easy.question: What is required when climbing an antenna tower?
Under what circumstances is it safe to climb a tower without a helper or observer?
Which of the following is an important safety precaution to observe when putting up an antenna tower?
easy.correct_answer: Look for and stay clear of any overhead electrical wires

easy.question: What is the purpose of a safety wire through a turnbuckle used to tension guy lines?
easy.correct_answer: Prevent loosening of the turnbuckle from vibration

easy.question: What is the minimum safe distance from a power line to allow when installing an antenna?
easy.correct_answer: Enough so that if the antenna falls, no part of it can come closer than 10 feet to the power wires

easy.question: Which of the following is an important safety rule to remember when using a crank-up tower?
easy.correct_answer: This type of tower must not be climbed unless it is retracted, or mechanical safety locking devices have been installed

easy.question: Which is a proper grounding method for a tower?
easy.correct_answer: Separate eight-foot ground rods for each tower leg, bonded to the tower and each other

easy.question: Why should you avoid attaching an antenna to a utility pole?
easy.correct_answer: The antenna could contact high-voltage power lines

easy.question: Which of the following is true when installing grounding conductors used for lightning protection?
Which of the following establishes grounding requirements for an amateur radio tower or antenna?
What type of radiation are radio signals?
At which of the following frequencies does maximum permissible exposure have the lowest value?
How does the allowable power density for RF safety change if duty cycle changes from 100 percent to 50 percent?
easy.correct_answer: It increases by a factor of 2

easy.question: What factors affect the RF exposure of people near an amateur station antenna?
Why do exposure limits vary with frequency?
easy.correct_answer: The human body absorbs more RF energy at some frequencies than at others

easy.question: Which of the following is an acceptable method to determine whether your station complies with FCC RF exposure regulations?
What hazard is created by touching an antenna during a transmission?
Which of the following actions can reduce exposure to RF radiation?
How can you make sure your station stays in compliance with RF safety regulations?
easy.correct_answer: By re-evaluating the station whenever an item in the transmitter or antenna system is changed

easy.question: Why is duty cycle one of the factors used to determine safe RF radiation exposure levels?
easy.correct_answer: It affects the average exposure to radiation

easy.question: What is the definition of duty cycle during the averaging time for RF exposure?
easy.correct_answer: The percentage of time that a transmitter is transmitting

easy.question: How does RF radiation differ from ionizing radiation (radioactivity)?
easy.correct_answer: RF radiation does not have sufficient energy to cause chemical changes in cells and damage DNA

easy.question: Who is responsible for ensuring that no person is exposed to RF energy above the FCC exposure limits?

medium.question: On which HF and/or MF amateur bands are there portions where General class licensees cannot transmit?
On which of the following bands is phone operation prohibited?
On which of the following bands is image transmission prohibited?
Which of the following amateur bands is restricted to communication only on specific channels, rather than frequency ranges?
On which of the following frequencies are General class licensees prohibited from operating as control operator?
Which of the following applies when the FCC rules designate the amateur service as a secondary user on a band?
medium.correct_answer: Amateur stations must not cause harmful interference to primary users and must accept interference from primary users

medium.question: Which of the following is a purpose of a beacon station as identified in the FCC rules?

medium.question: Which of the following one-way transmissions are permitted?

medium.question: Under what conditions are state and local governments permitted to regulate amateur radio antenna structures?

medium.question: When is it permissible to communicate with amateur stations in countries outside the areas administered by the Federal Communications Commission?

medium.question: What license examinations may you administer as an accredited Volunteer Examiner holding a General class operator license?

medium.question: When operating a station in South America by remote control over the internet from the US, what regulations apply?

medium.question: The frequency allocations of which ITU region apply to radio amateurs operating in North and South America?

What is the maximum PEP output allowed for spread spectrum transmissions?

medium.correct_answer: Under any circumstances in which third party messages are permitted by FCC rules

medium.question: Which mode is most commonly used for voice communications on frequencies of 14 MHz or higher?

medium.correct_answer: It is commonly accepted amateur practice

medium.correct_answer: Any stations outside the lower 48 states

medium.question: Who may be the control operator of an amateur station transmitting in RACES to assist relief operations during a disaster?

medium.question: When sending CW, what does a “C” mean when added to the RST report?
What prosign is sent to indicate the end of a formal message when using CW?
What does the Q signal “QSL” mean?

medium.question: Which of the following are objectives of the Volunteer Monitor Program?
medium.correct_answer: To encourage amateur radio operators to self-regulate and comply with the rules

medium.question: How is a directional antenna pointed when making a “long-path” contact with another station?

medium.question: Which of the following are examples of the NATO Phonetic Alphabet?
Why do many amateurs keep a station log?
medium.correct_answer: To help with a reply if the FCC requests information about your station

medium.question: Which of the following is required when participating in a contest on HF frequencies?
medium.correct_answer: Identify your station according to normal FCC regulations

medium.question: What is QRP operation?

medium.correct_answer: To allow each station to operate according to conditions

medium.question: Which mode is normally used when sending RTTY signals via AFSK with an SSB transmitter?

medium.question: What symptoms may result from other signals interfering with a PACTOR or VARA transmission?

medium.correct_answer: Find a clear frequency during the alternate time slot to the calling station

medium.question: In what segment of the 20-meter band are most digital mode operations commonly found?

medium.correct_answer: Joining an existing contact is not possible, PACTOR connections are limited to two stations

medium.question: Which of the following is a way to establish contact with a digital messaging system gateway station?

medium.question: What is the primary purpose of an Amateur Radio Emergency Data Network (AREDN) mesh network?
medium.correct_answer: To provide high-speed data services during an emergency or community event

medium.question: Which of the following describes Winlink?
What is another name for a Winlink Remote Message Server?
What could be wrong if you cannot decode an RTTY or other FSK signal even though it is apparently tuned in properly?
Which of the following is a common location for FT8?
How does a higher sunspot number affect HF propagation?
medium.correct_answer: Higher sunspot numbers generally indicate a greater probability of good propagation at higher frequencies

medium.question: What effect does a sudden ionospheric disturbance have on the daytime ionospheric propagation?

medium.question: Approximately how long does it take the increased ultraviolet and X-ray radiation from a solar flare to affect radio propagation on Earth?
Which of the following are the least reliable bands for long-distance communications during periods of low solar activity?
What is the solar flux index?
medium.correct_answer: A measure of solar radiation with a wavelength of 10.7 centimeters

medium.question: What is a geomagnetic storm?
medium.correct_answer: A temporary disturbance in Earth’s geomagnetic field

medium.question: At what point in the solar cycle does the 20-meter band usually support worldwide propagation during daylight hours?

medium.question: How long does it take a coronal mass ejection to affect radio propagation on Earth?
What does the K-index measure?

medium.question: What does the A-index measure?

medium.question: How is long distance radio communication usually affected by the charged particles that reach Earth from solar coronal holes?

medium.correct_answer: Use a network of automated receiving stations on the internet to see where your transmissions are being received

medium.question: What does LUF stand for?

medium.question: What does MUF stand for?
medium.correct_answer: The Maximum Usable Frequency for communications between two points

medium.question: Which of the following is typical of the lower HF frequencies during the summer?

medium.correct_answer: Desired power output without exceeding maximum allowable plate current

medium.question: What item of test equipment contains horizontal and vertical channel amplifiers?
